Define Documentation

#define FAST_TIMEOUT   50

gp_port_check_int_fast: : a GPPort : a pointer to an allocated buffer : the number of bytes that should be read

Reads a specified number of bytes from the inerrupt endpoint into the supplied buffer. Function waits 50 miliseconds for data on interrupt endpoint.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

Function Documentation

int gp_port_check_int ( GPPort *  port,
char *  data,
int  size 
)

gp_port_check_int: : a GPPort : a pointer to an allocated buffer : the number of bytes that should be read

Reads a specified number of bytes from the inerrupt endpoint into the supplied buffer. Function waits port->timeout miliseconds for data on interrupt endpoint.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_close ( GPPort *  port  ) 

gp_port_close: : a GPPort

Closes a temporarily. It can afterwards be reopened using gp_port_open.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_free ( GPPort *  port  ) 

gp_port_free: : a GPPort

Closes the and frees the memory.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

const char* gp_port_get_error ( GPPort *  port  ) 

gp_port_get_error: : a GPPort

Retrieves an error message from a . If you want to make sure that you get correct error messages, you need to call gp_port_set_error with an error message of NULL each time before calling another port-related function of which you want to check the return value.

Return value: an error message

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

gp_port_get_timeout: : a GPPort :

Retreives the current timeout of the port.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_new ( GPPort **  port  ) 

gp_port_new: :

Allocates the memory for a new GPPort. After you called this function, you probably want to call gp_port_set_info in order to make the newly created functional.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_open ( GPPort *  port  ) 

gp_port_open: : a GPPort

Opens a port which should have been created with gp_port_new and configured with gp_port_set_info and gp_port_set_settings

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

char *  data,
int  size

gp_port_read: : a GPPort : a pointer to an allocated buffer : the number of bytes that should be read

Reads a specified number of bytes from the port into the supplied buffer.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

const char *  format,
  ... 
)

gp_port_set_error: : a GPPort : @...:

Sets an error message that can later be retrieved using gp_port_get_error.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_set_info ( GPPort *  port,
GPPortInfo  info 
)

gp_port_set_info: : a GPPort : the GPPortInfo

Makes a functional. After calling this function, you can access the port using for example gp_port_open.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_set_settings ( GPPort *  port,
GPPortSettings  settings 
)

gp_port_set_settings: : a GPPort : the GPPortSettings to be set

Adjusts the settings of a port. You should always call gp_port_get_settings, adjust the values depending on the type of the port, and then call gp_port_set_settings.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

int gp_port_set_timeout ( GPPort *  port,
int  timeout 
)

gp_port_set_timeout: : a GPPort : the timeout

Sets the of a . gp_port_read will wait milliseconds for data. If no data will be received in that period, GP_ERROR_TIMEOUT will be returned.

Return value: a gphoto2 error code

Return value: a gphoto2 error code
